content:
Diagnosis:		Right breast cancer - Grade 2 invasive micropapillary carcinoma

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy
			February-March 2024 Adjuvant radiotherapy completed

Histology:		pT2N1(2/3)M0, Grade 2 pure micropapillary carcinoma
			ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative
			BRCA variant of uncertain significance

Current Situation:	Post-treatment surveillance review

I reviewed [redacted name] today following completion of adjuvant radiotherapy in March 2024. She has recovered well from both surgery and radiotherapy, with only mild residual skin changes in the treated area which are improving with regular moisturizer. Her right arm mobility has returned to normal following the physiotherapy exercises. She reports good energy levels and has returned to her usual activities. The surgical wound has healed well with no complications.

On examination today, there is mild skin pigmentation in the radiotherapy field but no concerning features. No palpable masses or lymphadenopathy identified. She will commence tamoxifen 20mg daily from today as planned.

The plan is for routine follow-up in 4 months with mammogram surveillance to begin at 1 year post-surgery. She understands to contact us sooner if any new concerns arise.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER 8/8, PR 7/8, HER2 negative, BRCA variant of uncertain significance

cancer_timeline.value: Right wide local excision and sentinel lymph node biopsy

patient_facts.value: Mild skin pigmentation in radiotherapy field, no palpable masses or lymphadenopathy
Mild residual skin changes in treated area

status_updates.value: Early breast cancer treated with surgery and radiotherapy. Good recovery from treatment with no complications.
Right arm mobility returned to normal, good energy levels and returned to usual activities
Mammogram surveillance to begin at 1 year post-surgery
